title: FF interface font size
content: For the recent past, the font size on FF tabs, url, bookmark bar, tabs and anything else to do with the actual FF program has a font so small that it is unreadable unless I use the W10 magnifier. I have spent hours, days and weeks trying everything I can find to increase the font size and nothing has worked. I am vision impaired and understand that everything cannot be adjusted to my needs BUT there are hundreds of postings on line by people with good vision complaining about the non adjustable font sizes. Does FF have any intentions on finding a fix for this? I am an avid user of FF but am at a point with my vision to where it is too problematic for me to continue using. If you cannot fix this issue then I must find a program that does not have this problem. It may very well be a conflict between FF and W10 but even that were the case, there are supposed to be a lot of intellingent individuals that should be able to remedy this situation. Please advise of your intentions as soon as possible in order that I may proceed with my plans. Sincerely, Ron Burnes
creator: AnaRonRanch

title: Syncing Mobile Devices
content:
I do not have any mobile device to sync with Firefox. HOWEVER, I would like to sync with Outlook.com from Microsoft. Centurylink my ISP provider was off-line for quite a while so they could create a better email program and when they finally came back online, last week, there were a list of things in computer language that I am supposed to do but do not understand. Like you, whenever I want to ask a question I have to send it via email then the response is the same thing listed in their instructions, NO HELP at all. Now, on a daily basis, I am receiving emails from Microsoft Outlook stating "Please update your credentials for the account Rhonda89@q.com." "It looks like we don't have permission to get email for Rhonda89@q.com."

The daily emails from Microsoft Outlook started on October 24, 2022, about the time Centurylink Email came back on line, I think. They did not send any messages advising us of this. I happened to find the information when I looked for it online.

I am still attempting to reach someone at Centurylink for help...lol

In the meantime, is there anything you can do to assist in this endeavour.

Thank you, Rhonda Caywood

title: google maps layers>more>labels toggle button not working
content:
the labels toggle button on google maps is unresponsive in both satellite and maps views. where do i find a setting to allow this button to become active? can i program the button to become active? thanks for any help.

i'm on windows 11 and use firefox web browser. both are up to date. i tried it on the microsoft edge browser and it works.

i've tried disabling all addons, restarted firefox, and problem still exists.

next i went through all of my firefox settings and toggled those that might apply. problem still exists.

next went into about:config and checked all settings not set at default. toggled any that might apply. problem still there.

any other suggestions in the community? is there a particular area of firefox i should look into closer. i would prefer not to have to reinstall or reconfigure firefox on a wholesale level. i have it highly customized and it would take multiple hours over a number of days to get everything back to where it is. this is the only site giving me a problem, and only this function on the site.

under layers/more the globe view toggle works fine, only the labels view toggle is not working.

i inspected the button element in 'firefox inspect' and found the attribute disabled="false". google maps is not honouring the attribute. when i remove the attribute, the button works. i cannot apply this across sessions though.

creator: elwin0275

title: Intermittent cookieless requests with Sec-Fetch-Mode=cors
content:
I'm trying to track down a problem in our (Java, Spring-based) web application, that seems to occur whenever some extra, unexpected requests arrive from Firefox, with no session cookie attached, and with some Sec-Fetch headers different from the requests before and after them:

Sec-Fetch-Dest=empty;Sec-Fetch-Mode=cors;Sec-Fetch-Site=same-origin

These requests do not appear in the Firefox developer panel, network tab, even with all requests selected.

But both the HTTP access log and a custom "log everything" filter show the above, with the same Firefox User Agent, no cookies, and no Referer header.

e.g. 9:13:12,426 DEBUG com.ibm.gs.houston.filters.RequestLogFilter:GET->http://localhost:9080/payment/pos?execution=e1s1 (null/false), headers:Host=localhost:9080;User-Agent=Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:107.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/107.0;Accept=*/*;Accept-Language=en-US,en;q=0.8,es-MX;q=0.5,es;q=0.3;Accept-Encoding=gzip, deflate, br;DNT=1;Connection=keep-alive;Sec-Fetch-Dest=empty;Sec-Fetch-Mode=cors;Sec-Fetch-Site=same-origin;, cookies:

I'm looking for any ideas why Fx is sending these requests.
creator: breaux65

I am really not sure what could be causing this. BTW i can install addons from https://addons.mozilla.org no problem. Could it be on your end?

buongiorno , ùnon riesco ad effettuare alcuna ricerca in firefox, comunica sito non sicuro e se procedo

Potrebbe trattarsi di un tentativo di sostituirsi al sito originale e non si dovrebbe proseguire.

I siti web garantiscono la propria identità attraverso certificati. Firefox non considera www.google.com attendibile in quanto l’emittente del certificato è sconosciuto, il certificato è autofirmato oppure il server non ha inviato i certificati intermedi previsti.

Codice di errore: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER

Visualizza certificato

title: Firefox detects my Windows 11 touch-screen laptop as a mobile device, so some websites do not work properly
content: My Windows 11 touch-screen laptop is perceived by Firefox as a mobile device, so some websites do not open properly. The main one I use often is https://french.typeit.org/ which allows typing French characters on a QWERTY keyboard. It works well with Firefox on my other, non-touch screen Windows 10 laptop but not on my touch-screen Windows 11 laptop. If I use Opera browser, no problems on either laptop. If you open that website, the special French characters (with accents on them) are supposed to be at the top of the page. On the Windows 11 laptop they are at the bottom, which would not matter at all, except they do not respond to keystrokes, but they do respond to finger touch. I asked the developer and he said it is because Firefox detects my laptop as a mobile device. The developer said he did not have any solutions for me and the problem is entirely with Firefox. I much prefer to use Firefox, but at least with this website, I have to use another browser. Is there anything I can do to fix this? Thank you.
creator: ffellag

title: Do not hijack CTRL+F in about:preferences
content:
I wanted to search for text within the Firefox Settings (about:preferences). I hit CTRL+F and instead of the usual search bar down below, it goes to the 'Find in Settings' field at the top and it starts filtering my results as I type. Filtering results is not the expected behavior for CTRL+F. And the the new, weird and distracting search highlights do not help the experience (They are trying to be smart, where all I wanted was a simple text search - see attached image).

If I'll want to use the filtering I'll use it, but please do not hijack the regular CTRL+F in the settings page. it is the most annoying behavior to change a shortcut only in one specific place whereas everywhere else it works the way you are used to.

How can I disable 'Find in Settings' search so CTRL+F works like everywhere else? (And please please remove this behavior in future releases).

title: Some Websites Not Working Correctly with Firefox 106.0.2
content: Some websites that should have pictures or animations within the body of their text are not showing up any more (the animations). Also, some websites have buttons to click that no longer work; it's not that any info is missing from input fields; the buttons simply don't work. Actual Example: I recently reformatted my hard drive a few days ago & re-downloaded and installed Firefox. Sometime later on, I signed into my McAfee account, although I kept receiving webpage error messages after sign-in stating the webpage I was seeking didn't exist. However, upon clicking on other buttons, it turned out I was actually signed-in. I went ahead and went to the download section of my account to re-download and install McAfee. No matter how many times I clicked the download button, nothing would happen. I established a chat session with McAfee Support; the Support Agent replied that others had complained about the same thing while using Firefox and the issue had been communicated to Mozilla, who supposedly knows about this and is working on a fix. The tech support agent advised me to use some other browser to download McAfee; I used Edge and the issue was successfully side-stepped. In the meantime, other websites that always have embedded animations or buttons to click don't work any more, either. Firefox has been my default browser of choice for years, but I have to go through the inconvenience to signing-out of whatever website I'm on and re-sign into that website again with Edge; a real pain. Please fix ASAP, and please give us a heads-up when this might be fixed, thanks.
creator: jhmotjr
